titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanley Thomas Williams Papers
titlestmt.author: Preliminary Inventory

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 09:30

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, notes, lectures, writings, and miscellanea relating to the academic career and literary works of Stanley T. Williams, a Yale University professor of American literature, including notes on several prominent American authors.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stanley Thomas Williams Papers (MS 557). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Stanley T. Williams (1888-1956): educator; B.A., Yale, 1911, M.A., 1914, Ph.D., 1915; instructor at Yale, 1915-1917, 1919-1920, 1920-1926, associate professor, 1926-1932, professor, 1932-1956; author of many books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, lectures, writings, and miscellanea relating to the academic career and literary works of Stanley T. Williams, a Yale University professor of American literature, including notes on several prominent American authors.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

controlaccess.persname: Brainard, John G. C. (John Gardiner Calkins), 1796-1828

did.unittitle: I Photostats: folded sheets of which the first is marked 1818; a journal starting 1 Mar 1828; 2 separate sheets. (Possibly photostats of notes for Washington Irving's Sketchbook .)
II Report on lecture series given at the University of Mexico

III Student paper on Hawthorne's The Scarlet Letter , 1928; ALS copy of Milt Gross' parody of "The Raven" in hand of E. W. Lewis, Y'28; Notes on English 57, 5 Feb 1947-1928 May 1947, taken by Robert B. Graves, Y'47Mar.
IV Bibliography of STW's published works, 1917-Apr 1944.
V A Collection of Published Melville Letters, prepared by English 378, University of Chicago, Summer Quarter
VI Papers and tests relating to English 36 and English 52
VII Examinations in English 56, 57, and 157, 24 Mar 1950 - 28 Oct 1955; Bibliography, Nathaniel Hawthorne, undated; Henry James Revisions, undated
XI "Honours" list of authors by assignment week, 1 Oct 1923 - 22 May 1924 List of anthologies, undated
XII TLS to STW from Frank MacShane
XIII Notes for various outside lectures
XVI 1 box, with role of microfilm of photostats of STW's articles for a book
XVII Lectures in England and Germany
"The Poetry of Edgar Allan Poe", London
"Washington Irving and Germany", Halle, 4 May, Berlin 15 May
The American Struggle for Intellectual Independence, Munich, 29 Apr, Hamburg, 11 May, Berlin, 15 May
XVIII Richard Alsop; Y'1798h: photostats of his correspondence, and correspondence concerning his life
XIX Brainard, John G. C.,Y'1815, notes, bibliographies, and copies of his correspondence.
"The Good and Great for Company": Our Literary Heritage
15 pages of typed ms, on European judgements of American literature
"Old Tragedies and New Books", North Carolina College for Women
Introduction to a volume on Irving
"The literary Criticism of William [illegible] Caldwell Roscoe"
"J. S. Mill as a Critic of Literature"
pp. 3, 5 ff on Cooper and Irving
Paper on the Spanish background of American literature
Preface to book on American literature for Europeans
Paper on fishing in Cape Cod ponds
